messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: CASE FILE: #H-9921-MN DATE: 09/15/27  Late in the evening on September 15, the city's main bank reported a significant security breach. Unidentified individuals managed to gain unauthorized access to the bank's central vault. Though no money was taken, sensitive documents and personal data of several high-profile clients were compromised. A multi-departmental team was set up to investigate this sophisticated heist.  LAW ENFORCEMENT RESPONSE:  INITIAL REPORT: Deputy J. K. L. Hawthorn was the first to receive the distress call from the bank and immediately relayed the seriousness to the central command. FORENSIC INVESTIGATION: Criminalist M. N. O. Carter initiated an on-site forensic investigation, focusing on fingerprints, electronic residues, and other potential clues. CYBERSECURITY ANALYSIS: Technician P. Q. R. Greene, with a background in cyber forensics, began probing into the bank's computer systems to trace the digital footprints of the perpetrators. EYE WITNESS ACCOUNTS: Sergeant S. T. U. Ford interviewed bank employees and customers who were present during the breach, piecing together a timeline of events. SURVEILLANCE FOOTAGE: Lieutenant V. W. X. Monroe coordinated with bank security to pull up and analyze all relevant security camera footage. PUBLIC REASSURANCE: Officer Y. Z. A. Daniels was assigned to manage public communications, quelling panic and assuring that all necessary steps were being taken. The bank breach posed unique challenges. Deputy Hawthorn's swift action was crucial in the immediate aftermath. Criminalist Carter's findings were foundational for the case. Technician Greene's cyber forensic skills were of immense value. Sgt. Ford's interviews shaped the narrative of the incident. Lt. Monroe's surveillance analysis identified potential suspects. Officer Daniels played a vital role in handling the public side of the situation.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Deputy J. K. L. Hawthorn  
Officer Context: Deputy Hawthorn received the initial report and conveyed the situation to central command.  
Officer Role: Deputy 

Officer Name: Criminalist M. N. O. Carter  
Officer Context: Criminalist Carter conducted an on-site forensic investigation, focusing on potential evidence.  
Officer Role: Criminalist 

Officer Name: Technician P. Q. R. Greene  
Officer Context: Technician Greene analyzed the bank's computer systems for digital evidence.  
Officer Role: Cyber Forensics Technician 

Officer Name: Sergeant S. T. U. Ford  
Officer Context: Sgt. Ford interviewed bank personnel and patrons, reconstructing the event's timeline.  
Officer Role: Sergeant 

Officer Name: Lieutenant V. W. X. Monroe  
Officer Context: Lt. Monroe coordinated the retrieval and analysis of security camera recordings.  
Officer Role: Lieutenant 

Officer Name: Officer Y. Z. A. Daniels  
Officer Context: Officer Daniels managed public communications and reassured the public.  
Officer Role: Public Relations Officer
